Column.Name: probe_id
Column.Description: Reference for the original probe design

Sample.Title: 343731_wtCy3-ahrCCy5

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown to MID-log phase in CDM with 10 mM arginine.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated and purified using the High Pure RNA isolation kit (Roche diagnostics) as described (Kloosterman et al., 2006). Contaminating genomic DNA was removed by treatment with RNase-free DNase I (Roche diagnostics). RNA was isolated from Four replicate cultures.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Total RNA was incubated for 16 h at 42°C in the presence of 400 U Superscript III RNase H reverse transcriptase (Invitrogen), 0.2 mM aminoallyl dUTP (Amersham), 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.3 mM dTTP, and 3.2 g random nonamers. The synthesized cDNA was then labeled by coupling either Cy3 or Cy5 to the dUTP aminoallyl reactive group (CyScribe postlabeling kit; Amersham Biosciences) and was purified using a GFX PCR, DNA, and gel band purification kit (Amersham Biosciences

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown to MID-log phase in CDM with 10 mM arginine.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was isolated and purified using the High Pure RNA isolation kit (Roche diagnostics) as described (Kloosterman et al., 2006). Contaminating genomic DNA was removed by treatment with RNase-free DNase I (Roche diagnostics). RNA was isolated from Four replicate cultures.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Total RNA was incubated for 16 h at 42°C in the presence of 400 U Superscript III RNase H reverse transcriptase (Invitrogen), 0.2 mM aminoallyl dUTP (Amersham), 0.5 mM dATP, 0.5 mM dCTP, 0.5 mM dGTP, 0.3 mM dTTP, and 3.2 g random nonamers. The synthesized cDNA was then labeled by coupling either Cy3 or Cy5 to the dUTP aminoallyl reactive group (CyScribe postlabeling kit; Amersham Biosciences) and was purified using a GFX PCR, DNA, and gel band purification kit (Amersham Biosciences

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: The protocol was performed as described in Kloosterman TG et al., 2006b
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanning was done using the Genepix 4200AL laser scanner
Sample.Data-Processing: Dual-channel array images were analyzed with Genepix Pro software. Spots were screened visually to identify those of low quality. Slide data were processed with MicroPreP. Prior to analysis, automatically and manually flagged spots and spots with very low background subtracted signal intensity (5% of the weakest spots [sum of Cy3 and Cy5 net signals]) were filtered out of all data sets.Net signal intensities were calculated by grid-based background subtraction. A grid-based Lowess transformation was performed for slide normalization, negative and empty values were removed, and outliers were removed by the deviation test. Expression ratios of ahrC mutant strain over the D39 wild-type strain were calculated. Further analysis was performed with a Cyber-T Student t test for paired data.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: LN ratio (Target /Control = ahrC mutant/wild type=ch2/ch1) and grid based lowess normalisation

Series.Title: ArgR1 and AhrC Mediate Arginine-Dependent Regulation of Arginine Acquisition- and Virulence Genes in the Human Pathogen Streptococcus pneumoniae
Series.Summary: This SuperSeries is composed of the following subset Series: GSE33033: ahrC mutant compared to D39 wild-type in Streptococcus pneumoniae in CDM + 10 mM arginine GSE33034: argR1 mutant compared to D39 wild-type in Streptococcus pneumoniae in CDM + 10 mM arginine GSE33035: argR1-ahrC mutant compared to D39 wild-type in Streptococcus pneumoniae in CDM + 10 mM arginine GSE33036: Streptococcus pneumoniae D39 wild-type grown in CDM+10 mM arginine compared to D39 wild type grown in CDM + 0.05 mM arginine
